entities.name: wormtail
entities.description: Wormtail is a character in the story, described as having wrapped the stump of his arm in his robes and being choked with emotion. He is addressed by Voldemort as 'my Lord' and 'Master'. (Excerpt: 'My Lord . . .’ he choked, “my Lord . . . you promised . . . you did promise . . .”')

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is a character in the story, described as lazy and cruel. He is addressed by Wormtail as 'Master' and is shown to be examining Wormtail's arm with interest. (Excerpt: ‘“Hold out your arm,” sa id Voldemort lazily.')

entities.name: the dark mark
entities.description: The Dark Mark is a symbol described as a vivid red tattoo on Wormtail's skin, featuring a skull with a snake protruding from its mouth. It is mentioned to have appeared in the sky at the Quidditch World Cup. (Excerpt: 'the image that had appeared in the sky at the Quidditch World Cup: the Dark Mark')

relationships.description: Voldemort has control over Wormtail, as evidenced by Wormtail's submissive behavior and Voldemort's ability to order him around. (Excerpt: '“Hold out your arm,” sa id Voldemort lazily.')
Voldemort examines Wormtail's arm, specifically the Dark Mark. (Excerpt: 'Voldemort bent down and pulled out Wormtail’s left arm; he forced the sleeve of Wormtail’s ro bes up past his elbow...')
